reviews.review: GOOD
좋은 게임임.

DBD é um game de PvP assimétrico 1v4, onde o "1" é um killer  e o "4" é um grupo de survivors que precisam cumprir alguns objetivos para escaparem do mapa enquanto são caçados pelo supracitado killer. Apesar da premissa simples de entender, aprender a jogar é uma atividade complexa que demanda muitas, muitas horas. Tal qual acontece com MOBAs, é preciso aliar memória mecânica com conhecimentos teóricos de mecânica de jogo (interações, counterplays, mindgames etc.). Farei um resumo superficial:
Os mapas são gerados proceduralmente com tiles, ou seja, os pedaços do mapa possuem padrões de layout mas a disposição deles é aleatória.
Quanto ao gameplay, o killer joga em 1ª pessoa e os survivors jogam com visão em 3ª pessoa. Quando escrevi esta review originalmente, o jogo possuia um pool de 18 Killers, cada um possuindo habilidades únicas; e 20 survivors. Além da skill do killer, há os perks, buffs secundários com diversos impactos no gameplay. Ambos os lados possuem 3 perks específicos, que eventualmente na progressão do player ingame são liberados para todos os outros da mesma subcategoria (cada killer possui 3 perks específicos que vc pode liberar para os outros killers; cada survivor possui 3 perks específicos que vc pode liberar para os outros survivors) - fora alguns perks genéricos que são originalmente disponíveis para todos da subcategoria.
Além destes, cada killer possui add-ons consumíves que alteram aspectos de sua skill e os survivors possuem itens consumíveis com uma gama de add-ons específicos que incrementam o gameplay.
A versão base do jogo frequentemente entra em sales; as DLCs licenciadas não são obteníveis sem $, mas as DLCs proprietárias da developer são farmáveis com a currency ingame.
O jogo tem uma playerbase decentemente grande, ainda que majoritariamente tóxica (o padrão de joguinhos online pvp, convenhamos), e continua a receber expansões - usualmente trimestralmente - com novos conteúdos. Quem quiser realmente mergulhar no universo DBD, uma boa pedida é dar uma olhada no conteúdo de streamers e youtubers para aprimorar o próprio gameplay.
Tl;dr: é um game divertido à beça, mas não é casual-friendly. Padrão MOBA, vc encontrará cotocos e tryhards. Mas se vc for um cotoco, esteja preparado para ser triturado.

Edit: steam awards. Oh well, mais bonecos foram implementados no jogo (e outros mais estão para chegar), de maneira que meus números já estão desatualizados!!

As of Mid-Chaper Patch 6.1.0 I can now proudly say that BHVR have improved the game experience in my eyes. Many people might argue otherwise but I now really enjoy playing DBD again. The new patch changed up the meta which was necessary after 5 years of staying the same and now makes Killer games more bearable. Just know that as a new player you will have to invest a lot of time into this game to understand most things as there are 204 perks in total that all have different effects (some more than others) and 28 killers with different abilities and multiple add-ons for these abilities that change them (also some more than others). New players will likely be frustrated at this massive amount of things to consider and undertsand, which likely wont get better for the forseeable future but if you are insane enought and have enough time to learn this game it is really fun until BHVR decides to do some stupid change to mess it all up again.
Buy at own risk

I've played this game for a decently long time as a killer main, though I also have played a lot of survivor. I just uninstalled the game today until the devs actually do something about the fact that at high levels of play, the game is so heavily favored towards survivors it is actively nauseating. Every perk run by survivors lets them get away with playing exceedingly poorly and still winning by a large margin. I've played both sides and let me tell you, at high levels of play, survivor is easy coasting along and you almost never have to try hard once you understand the game. As killer at the same levels of play, with the same understanding of the game, the game is brutally difficult and you will rarely win unless you are one of the few killers with 5000+ hours of experience and no life outside of the game (which are the only ones who are capable of keeping up with the survivors).

This game is not balanced for the survivors having voice comms, which is why the Survive With Friends party mechanic completely breaks the game, on top of survivor perks being stupidly strong.

I'll change my review to recommend this shitshow and reinstall my game as soon as the devs split the queue into casual/unranked with SWF and ranked solo only play, but that's unlikely to happen because the devs don't understand their own game or what makes it "work," which makes them terrified of making real changes to it. Hell, it's taken them three and a half years so far to implement a penalty for ragequitting and ruining the match for everyone (which has led to the game being just a DC-fest for survivors as soon as the match isn't going their way), and it still isn't implemented properly. I am genuinely of the opinion that this is one of the worst developers in the business and that they've absolutely 100% lucked out with this game so far. They have not done a good job on anything but the visual design. They introduce more bugs than features with every DLC and they aren't fixing the most glaring ones (that also somehow seem to affect killers disproportionately more than survivors). This game doesn't deserve the playerbase that it has, and BHVR doesn't seem to care much about their playerbase at all.

tl;dr, don't get the game unless you love unbalanced piles of toxicity in which you will be flamed to shit in the postgame chat regardless of match result and reporting does nothing. Playerbase is more toxic than LoL.

With the edition of adding it to Epic Games, they have changed the colors of blood from red to blue, and I feel that the game is no longer immersive. I can't recommend this game in this point in time either, it has gotten boring recently for me as well, no new gameplay and it's been the same with bugs and endless feedback lag. Wait for it to go on sale if you are going to purchase this game.

游戏的处罚机制非常不公平·，当玩逃生者遇到守尸的屠夫时，玩家强制退出，玩家会受到惩罚，但屠夫不会受到惩罚，所以这个游戏除非你有主播一样的技术，要不然你可能就会被搞崩心态。如果你不在意屠夫针对你的话，你可以尝试这个游戏，但如果你很在乎自己的心态，就最好不要玩。

Spielprinzip ist recht einfach: Einer gegen Alle. An sich nichts neues, aber die Umsetzung ist nicht schlecht und es kann durchaus Spaß machen.

Allerdings wird dieser Spaß durch eine, meiner Meinung nach, unmögliche Programmierung in Sachen Hitboxen, Connect und Matchmaking so gewaltig durch Frust überstrahlt, dass ich dieses Spiel nun erstmal deinstallieren werde un vielleicht in nem Jahr nochmal reinschaue, wenn die Priotitäten der Entwickler bei Bugfixing angekommen sind.

玩了一段时间，看了许多旧杀鸡视频，对比起来现在的杀鸡个人认为是最好玩的时候，各种游戏机制逐渐完善，杀戮和快中慢翻窗机制使无敌点不再绕到世界末日；终局机制使得人屠不再在地窖面前互相等对方先出手，也不会有人类已经可以逃走偏偏在大门口一直赖着不走嘲讽屠夫；得分上段机制极大程度减小了屠夫守尸欲望，促使人类去互相合作。
不过游戏的优化一直是个大问题，每次更新一堆Bug已经是喜闻乐见，好友邀请时灵时不灵。以及难以平衡的人屠关系，低端局屠夫重拳出击，高端局被溜的找不着北，屠夫因为抓不到人又怕速修被逼去玩幻神，人类又因为幻神更加专注速修，死循环。走地屠夫有意思但不好抓人，幻神好抓人玩久了又没意思。以及令人费解的等级开放技能槽，血点升级开技能还能理解，技能槽真是巴不得劝退萌新
对杀鸡有兴趣的建议打折购买，万一不对胃口也不是很心疼。新人建议多看游戏视频，比在游戏里瞎练要有帮助得多

There is a learning curve to get the hang of most things and how to deal with certain killers etc, but it is quite fun, even more so with friends. Like most "ranked" games there are those sad individuals who go out of their way to bully new and low players but its best to just ignore them and power through that behavior.

If you love hating yourself and love getting enough time to shit while queued up for a game only to get put into a match that lasts 2 minutes long to do it all again then this game is great for you! 

Start the game off with no idea what looping is or how to do it, with your buddies screaming at you when you go down before the first gen goes off, and killers that tunnel you, this game is pure bliss.

11/10 would die again
